1: -module(ct_telnet_own_server_SUITE).
    2: 
    3: -compile(export_all).
    4: 
    5: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    6: 
    7: %% telnet control characters
    8: -define(SE,	240).
    9: -define(NOP,	241).
   10: -define(DM,	242).
   11: -define(BRK,	243).
   12: -define(IP,	244).
   13: -define(AO,	245).
   14: -define(AYT,	246).
   15: -define(EC,	247).
   16: -define(EL,	248).
   17: -define(GA,	249).
   18: -define(SB,	250).
   19: -define(WILL,	251).
   20: -define(WONT,	252).
   21: -define(DO,	253).
   22: -define(DONT,	254).
   23: -define(IAC,	255).
   24: 
   25: -define(SHORT_TIME,2000).
   26: 
   27: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   28: %% TEST SERVER CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
   29: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   30: 
   31: suite() ->
   32:     [{require,telnet_server_conn1,{unix,[telnet]}},
   33:      {require,ct_conn_log},
   34:      {ct_hooks, [{cth_conn_log,[{ct_telnet, [{prefix, short}]}]}]}
   35:     ].
   36: 
   37: all() ->
   38:     [
   39:      expect,
   40:      expect_repeat,
   41:      expect_sequence,
   42:      expect_wait_until_prompt,
   43:      expect_error_prompt,
   44:      expect_error_timeout1,
   45:      expect_error_timeout2,
   46:      expect_error_timeout3,
   47:      total_timeout_less_than_idle,
   48:      no_prompt_check,
   49:      no_prompt_check_repeat,
   50:      no_prompt_check_sequence,
   51:      no_prompt_check_timeout,
   52:      ignore_prompt,
   53:      ignore_prompt_repeat,
   54:      ignore_prompt_sequence,
   55:      ignore_prompt_timeout,
   56:      large_string,
   57:      server_speaks,
   58:      server_disconnects,
   59:      newline_ayt,
   60:      newline_break,
   61:      newline_string
   62:     ].
   63: 
   64: groups() ->
   65:     [].
   66: 
   67: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   68:     ct:pal("Will use these log hook options: ~p",
   69: 	   [ct:get_config(ct_conn_log,[])]),
   70:     Config.
   71: 
   72: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   73:     ok.
   74: 
   75: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   76:     Config.
   77: 
   78: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   79:     Config.
   80: 
   81: %% Simple expect
   82: expect(_) ->
   83:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
   84:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo ayt"),
   85:     {ok,["ayt"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, "ayt"),
   86:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo ayt"),
   87:     {ok,["ayt"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["ayt"]),
   88:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
   89:     ok.
   90: 
   91: %% Expect with repeat option
   92: expect_repeat(_) ->
   93:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
   94:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml xy xy"),
   95:     {ok,[["xy"],["xy"]],done} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xy"],[{repeat,2}]),
   96:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
   97:     ok.
   98: 
   99: %% Expect with sequence option
  100: expect_sequence(_) ->
  101:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  102:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml ab cd ef"),
  103:     {ok,[["ab"],["cd"],["ef"]]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle,
  104: 						   [["ab"],["cd"],["ef"]],
  105: 						   [sequence]),
  106:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  107:     ok.
  108: 
  109: %% Check that expect can wait for delayed prompt
  110: expect_wait_until_prompt(_) ->
  111:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  112:     Timeouts = [{idle_timeout,5000},{total_timeout,7000}],
  113: 
  114:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_delayed_prompt 3000 xxx"),
  115:     {ok,["xxx"]} =
  116: 	ct_telnet:expect(Handle, "xxx",
  117: 			 [wait_for_prompt|Timeouts]),
  118:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_delayed_prompt 3000 yyy zzz"),
  119:     {ok,[["yyy"],["zzz"]]} =
  120: 	ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy","zzz"],
  121: 			 [{wait_for_prompt,"> "}|Timeouts]),
  122:     ok.
  123: 
  124: %% Check that expect returns when a prompt is found, even if pattern
  125: %% is not matched.
  126: expect_error_prompt(_) ->
  127:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  128:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx> yyy"),
  129:     {error,{prompt,"> "}} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"]),
  130:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  131:     ok.
  132: 
  133: %% Check that expect returns after idle timeout, and even if the
  134: %% expected pattern is received - as long as not newline or prompt is
  135: %% received it will not match.
  136: expect_error_timeout1(_) ->
  137:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  138:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt xxx"),
  139:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [{timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  140:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  141:     ok.
  142: 
  143: expect_error_timeout2(_) ->
  144:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  145:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt xxx"),
  146:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [{idle_timeout,1000},
  147: 							 {total_timeout,infinity}]),
  148:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  149:     ok.
  150: 
  151: %% Check that if server loops and pattern not matching, the operation
  152: %% can be aborted
  153: expect_error_timeout3(_) ->
  154:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  155:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_loop 5000 xxx"),
  156: 
  157:     T0 = now(),
  158:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"],
  159: 				       [{idle_timeout,infinity},
  160: 					{total_timeout,2001}]),
  161:     Diff = trunc(timer:now_diff(now(),T0)/1000),
  162:     {_,true} = {Diff, (Diff >= 2000) and (Diff =< 4000)},
  163: 
  164:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo ayt"),
  165:     {ok,["ayt"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["ayt"]),
  166:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  167:     ok.
  168:     
  169: %% OTP-12335: If total_timeout < idle_timeout, expect will never timeout
  170: %% until after idle_timeout, which is incorrect.
  171: total_timeout_less_than_idle(_) ->
  172:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  173:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt xxx"),
  174: 
  175:     T0 = now(),
  176:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"],
  177: 				       [{idle_timeout,5000},
  178: 					{total_timeout,2001}]),
  179:     Diff = trunc(timer:now_diff(now(),T0)/1000),
  180:     {_,true} = {Diff, (Diff >= 2000) and (Diff =< 4000)},
  181: 
  182:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo ayt"),
  183:     {ok,["ayt"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["ayt"]),
  184:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  185:     ok.
  186: 
  187: %% expect with ignore_prompt option should not return even if a prompt
  188: %% is found. The pattern after the prompt (here "> ") can be matched.
  189: ignore_prompt(_) ->
  190:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  191:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx> yyy"),
  192:     {ok,["yyy"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"], [ignore_prompt]),
  193:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  194:     ok.
  195: 
  196: %% expect with ignore_prompt and repeat options.
  197: ignore_prompt_repeat(_) ->
  198:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  199:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml yyy> yyy>"),
  200:     {ok,[["yyy"],["yyy"]],done} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"],
  201: 						   [{repeat,2},
  202: 						    ignore_prompt]),
  203:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  204:     ok.
  205: 
  206: %% expect with ignore_prompt and sequence options.
  207: ignore_prompt_sequence(_) ->
  208:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  209:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml xxx> yyy> zzz> "),
  210:     {ok,[["xxx"],["yyy"],["zzz"]]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle,
  211: 						      [["xxx"],["yyy"],["zzz"]],
  212: 						      [sequence,
  213: 						       ignore_prompt]),
  214:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  215:     ok.
  216: 
  217: %% Check that expect returns after idle timeout when ignore_prompt
  218: %% option is used.
  219: %% As for expect without the ignore_prompt option, it a newline or a
  220: %% prompt is required in order for the pattern to match.
  221: ignore_prompt_timeout(_) ->
  222:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  223:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx"),
  224:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"], [ignore_prompt,
  225: 							 {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  226:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx"), % sends prompt and newline
  227:     {ok,["xxx"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [ignore_prompt,
  228: 						      {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  229:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt xxx\n"), % no prompt, but newline
  230:     {ok,["xxx"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [ignore_prompt,
  231: 						      {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  232:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt xxx"), % no prompt, no newline
  233:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [ignore_prompt,
  234: 							 {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  235:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  236:     ok.
  237: 
  238: %% no_prompt_check option shall match pattern both when prompt is sent
  239: %% and when it is not.
  240: no_prompt_check(_) ->
  241:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  242:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx"),
  243:     {ok,["xxx"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["xxx"], [no_prompt_check]),
  244:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt yyy"),
  245:     {ok,["yyy"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"], [no_prompt_check]),
  246:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  247:     ok.
  248: 
  249: %% no_prompt_check and repeat options
  250: no_prompt_check_repeat(_) ->
  251:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  252:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml xxx xxx"),
  253:     {ok,[["xxx"],["xxx"]],done} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle,["xxx"],
  254: 						   [{repeat,2},
  255: 						    no_prompt_check]),
  256:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml_no_prompt yyy yyy"),
  257:     {ok,[["yyy"],["yyy"]],done} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle,["yyy"],
  258: 						   [{repeat,2},
  259: 						    no_prompt_check]),
  260:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  261:     ok.
  262: 
  263: %% no_prompt_check and sequence options
  264: no_prompt_check_sequence(_) ->
  265:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  266:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_ml_no_prompt ab cd ef"),
  267:     {ok,[["ab"],["cd"],["ef"]]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle,
  268: 						   [["ab"],["cd"],["ef"]],
  269: 						   [sequence,
  270: 						    no_prompt_check]),
  271:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  272:     ok.
  273: 
  274: %% Check that expect returns after idle timeout when no_prompt_check
  275: %% option is used.
  276: no_prompt_check_timeout(_) ->
  277:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  278:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo xxx"),
  279:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yyy"], [no_prompt_check,
  280: 							 {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  281:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  282:     ok.
  283: 
  284: %% Check that it's possible to receive multiple chunks of data sent from
  285: %% the server with one get_data call
  286: large_string(_) ->
  287:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  288:     String = "abcd efgh ijkl mnop qrst uvwx yz ",
  289:     BigString = lists:flatmap(fun(S) -> S end,
  290: 			      [String || _ <- lists:seq(1,10)]),
  291:     VerifyStr = [C || C <- BigString, C/=$ ],
  292: 
  293:     {ok,Data} = ct_telnet:cmd(Handle, "echo_sep "++BigString),
  294:     ct:log("[CMD] Received ~w chars: ~s", [length(lists:flatten(Data)),Data]),
  295:     VerifyStr = [C || C <- lists:flatten(Data), C/=$ , C/=$\r, C/=$\n, C/=$>],
  296: 
  297:     %% Test #1: With a long sleep value, all data gets gets buffered and
  298:     %% ct_telnet can receive it with one single request to ct_telnet_client.
  299:     %% Test #2: With a short sleep value, ct_telnet needs multiple calls to
  300:     %% ct_telnet_client to collect the data. This iterative operation should
  301:     %% yield the same result as the single request case.
  302: 
  303:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_sep "++BigString),
  304:     ct:sleep(1000),
  305:     {ok,Data1} = ct_telnet:get_data(Handle),
  306:     ct:log("[GET DATA #1] Received ~w chars: ~s",
  307: 	   [length(lists:flatten(Data1)),Data1]),
  308:     VerifyStr = [C || C <- lists:flatten(Data1), C/=$ , C/=$\r, C/=$\n, C/=$>],
  309: 
  310:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_sep "++BigString),
  311:     %% On some slow machines, 50 ms might not be enough to get the
  312:     %% first packet of data. We will therefore keep trying for a
  313:     %% second before we give up this...
  314:     F = fun RepeatUntilData(N) ->
  315: 		ct:sleep(50),
  316: 		case ct_telnet:get_data(Handle) of
  317: 		    {ok,[]} when N>1 ->
  318: 			RepeatUntilData(N-1);
  319: 		    Other ->
  320: 			Other
  321: 		end
  322: 	end,
  323:     {ok,Data2} = F(20),
  324:     ct:log("[GET DATA #2] Received ~w chars: ~s", [length(lists:flatten(Data2)),Data2]),
  325:     VerifyStr = [C || C <- lists:flatten(Data2), C/=$ , C/=$\r, C/=$\n, C/=$>],
  326: 
  327:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  328:     ok.
  329: 
  330: %% The server says things. Manually check that it gets printed correctly
  331: %% in the general IO log.
  332: %%
  333: %% In this test case we simulate data sent spontaneously from the
  334: %% server. We use ct_telnet_client:send_data instead of ct_telnet:send
  335: %% to avoid flushing of buffers in the client, and we use
  336: %% echo_no_prompt since the server would normally not send a prompt in
  337: %% this case.
  338: server_speaks(_) ->
  339:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  340: 
  341:     Backdoor = ct_gen_conn:get_conn_pid(Handle),
  342:     ok = ct_telnet_client:send_data(Backdoor,
  343: 				    "echo_no_prompt This is the first message"),
  344:     ok = ct_telnet_client:send_data(Backdoor,
  345: 				    "echo_no_prompt This is the second message"),
  346:     %% Let ct_telnet_client get an idle timeout. This should print the
  347:     %% two messages to the log. Note that the buffers are not flushed here!
  348:     ct:sleep(15000),
  349:     ok = ct_telnet_client:send_data(Backdoor,
  350: 				    "echo_no_prompt This is the third message"),
  351:     {ok,_} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["first.*second.*third"],
  352: 			      [no_prompt_check, sequence]),
  353:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["the"], [no_prompt_check,
  354: 							 {timeout,?SHORT_TIME}]),
  355:     ok = ct_telnet_client:send_data(Backdoor,
  356: 				    "echo_no_prompt This is the fourth message"),
  357:     %% give the server time to respond
  358:     ct:sleep(2000),
  359:     %% closing the connection should print last message in log
  360:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  361:     ok.  
  362: 
  363: %% Let the server close the connection. Make sure buffered data gets printed
  364: %% to the general IO log.
  365: server_disconnects(_) ->
  366:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  367:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "disconnect_after 1500"),
  368:     %% wait until the get_data operation (triggered by send/2) times out
  369:     %% before sending the msg
  370:     ct:sleep(500),
  371:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo_no_prompt This is the message"),
  372:     %% when the server closes the connection, the last message should be
  373:     %% printed in the log
  374:     ct:sleep(3000),
  375:     _ = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  376:     ok.
  377: 
  378: %% Test option {newline,false} to send telnet command sequence.
  379: newline_ayt(_) ->
  380:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  381:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, [?IAC,?AYT], [{newline,false}]),
  382:     {ok,["yes"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["yes"]),
  383:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  384:     ok.
  385: 
  386: %% Test option {newline,false} to send telnet command sequence.
  387: newline_break(_) ->
  388:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  389:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, [?IAC,?BRK], [{newline,false}]),
  390:     %% '#' is the prompt in break mode
  391:     {ok,["# "]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["# "], [no_prompt_check]),
  392:     {ok,R} = ct_telnet:cmd(Handle, "q", [{newline,false}]),
  393:     "> " = lists:flatten(R),
  394:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  395:     ok.
  396: 
  397: %% Test option {newline,String} to specify an own newline, e.g. "\r\n"
  398: newline_string(_) ->
  399:     {ok, Handle} = ct_telnet:open(telnet_server_conn1),
  400:     ok = ct_telnet:send(Handle, "echo hello-", [{newline,"own_nl\n"}]),
  401:     {ok,["hello-own_nl"]} = ct_telnet:expect(Handle, ["hello-own_nl"]),
  402:     ok = ct_telnet:close(Handle),
  403:     ok.
